website_summaries.verdict: A powerful yet compact electric log splitter that is capable of splitting seasoned logs that are 12-inches in diameter.
pros: Powerhouse's 9-ton log splitter is easy to use and features an impressive 4-HP motor that can quickly handle wood that other machines in this price range can't
It is only 40-inches long and weighs about 120 pounds so it is fairly portable
cons: Although it is designed with safety as the top priority, the two-handed operation may frustrate more experienced users

customer_reviews.title: Dont think twice.
customer_reviews.text: Finally fired it up. 12" twisted knotted cherry and apple are no match. Like "ohh, this is all you got?" 5 stars. A little spendier than cheap 5 tons but less than bi-directional 10 ton and you can prolly hack a 5/7 ton by changing springs. But this definitely is doing the job. Good cycle time too.. and pretty quiet. Suprisingly so.
customer_reviews.author: cx

customer_reviews.title: Performs well
customer_reviews.text: This 9-ton log splitter does the job quite nicely and easily handles up to 12" diameter logs. It is quiet compared to gas powered machines. I like this log splitter very much! I rated this a 4 not because of how it performs, but rather these things. The instruction manual was inadequate. The instructions to put it together had very small and rather unclear pictures and rather vague and poor descriptions. I was not familiar with hydraulics and was unsure of how much oil to put in because it seemed it already had some when it arrived. I was able to assemble it but it took longer than I would expected if the instructions had been clearer and more precise.
customer_reviews.author: Francais

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, could be better
customer_reviews.text: For a 9 ton splitter, it seems a little underpowered. Does pretty well at splitting hardwood logs up to 15" diameter, as long as there are no knots. The safety feature (having to hold down 2 levers at once) is extremely annoying for experienced loggers, as is the shut-off when it overloads due to a log that's too much for it to split. You have to turn off the splitter and turn it back on to reset. For once a year, it does a decent job. Portability is a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: K. Huffman

customer_reviews.title: Get one you wont regret it.
customer_reviews.text: Works amazing and is quiet. I split rounds well over 18 inches no problem had a few it didnt like the machine stalled for a second it kills the hydraulics until you let off and turn the motor off and back on. Looks great and gets it done quick. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Goodrich

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: My splitter showed with hardware missing. I found some nuts and bolts in my garage that I made work. The directions are horrible. It does not say what tools are needed. I had to buy snap ring pliers in order to get the wheels on. Not sure how many people have a set of snap ring pliers laying around. Then I turned it on to test it. It moved very slowly and I could hold the ram back with my hand. It barely put and indentation on a log I tried to split. So I took it back apart, repackaged it, and I'm sending it back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Randy M.

customer_reviews.title: Used for just a few minutes before it  began leaking hydraulic fluid all over!
customer_reviews.text: I used my new Powerhouse" xm 580 9 ton log splitter for just a few minutes before it began leaking hydraulic fluid all over! Oil is coming out of the motor into the electrical box. The vent was open, so I'm not sure what's up. Have had no luck trying to contact seller or company! I also suspect this had been previously owned and returned because one of the motor cover screws was a mismatch.
customer_reviews.author: Ken and Patrice

customer_reviews.title: It's short
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this little beast, it'll split anything up to it spec limit, I think 12 inches thick, 20 inches long and then some. very smooth as you'd expect from a hydraulic electric system, but i think I will build a little platform to save my back, you can operate the control levers by foot to ease your back but I don't trust myself not to bust one or fall over when trying. Great value for money small size is great fo storage.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Storability and power.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and use. Had all the power I needed to split a face cord of freshly cut hard maple. I really appreciate how easily it stores in my garage. Storage was the big reason that I never purchased a gas operated splitter. I can easily throw this in the back of my truck and take it to the cabin when needed. Would highly recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.text: The Powerhouse XM 580 is a powerful splitter. I split a cord of wood in short order and with the exception of a few pieces of thick mesquite, it sliced thru the wood very good. Most of the wood was oak and the machine did a great job. I have always rented a gas splitter before for over a $100 a day. This machine came close to replicating the gas machines, only it is much quieter. As an added plus, received the splitter one day earlier too! Only drawback was the instructions were somewhat vague.
customer_reviews.author: Mama

customer_reviews.title: worked as expected
customer_reviews.text: splitter was easy to assemble, transport, and store. worked better than expected, splitting logs easily 12" diameter. Larger pieces could be adjusted to split smaller pieces off until getting it down to size. i did run into difficulty splitting a log where a branch enters. But, that was expected. Im very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: speterson

customer_reviews.title: Depends on what your looking for!
customer_reviews.text: This is a powerful piece of equipment but does lack ease of use. Very low to the ground and does not transfer well across uneven terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M.

customer_reviews.title: Works as good or better than stated.
customer_reviews.text: Can be awkward to use, and ram could go a couple inches further, some logs still have fibers that have to be separated by hand. Instructions say you have to have a 30 amp circuit (breaker), but so far I can only find 25 amp outlet configuration 120 volt. outlets for 30 amp seems to start 240 volt configuration. I tried it in a 15 amp outlet and it split a couple big oak logs without a problem. I did add a 25 amp breaker, and outlet, on 10 gauge wire to give the motor as much power as I can.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie

customer_reviews.title: Don’t
customer_reviews.text: This product came in with the guide rails bent, screws missing and instructions that are impossible to understand. This has to be one of the worst purchases I’ve made in a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, durable appearing machine
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful and effective. My only issue was that a couple of the attachment screws were missing, but I will be contacting the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Eric W. Metzler

customer_reviews.title: Be careful manufacturer doesn't give a damn!
customer_reviews.text: Used splitter for two years work great. One morning turned it on only a buzz blew circuit breaker. Contacted company got right back told them problem,then I mentioned I bought it from Amazon, since then they will not answer emails. All I wanted to know what new motor would cost.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Received 7 ton - works well.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 9 ton and received a 7 ton. Amazon refunded me the difference. The 7 ton can split a 15" X 15" wet log or 20" X 20S" dry log. I rigged a thick piece of Styrofoam to cover the two handles so I could press them both down at once. The splitter does a good job but has a lot of trouble with knotted wood.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Klein

customer_reviews.title: Not quite as powerful as I would have liked, but it is doing what a 9 ton ...
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as powerful as I would have liked, but it is doing what a 9 ton splitter should do. My only real complaint is you have to use both handles at the same time to operate this unit making it a two hand operation rather than one - unless of course you have really big hands...
customer_reviews.author: Bill Landon

customer_reviews.title: Great sitter
customer_reviews.text: Not the one I ordered but works really good.splits up to 12 inch logs
customer_reviews.author: Rick Dennis

customer_reviews.title: A great splitter. Better than advertised.
customer_reviews.text: This splitter is unbelievable. Does a great job. Very simple and safe to use. Installation could have been easy BUT the wheels are attached with a split “O” ring that needs a special tool to put it on. Got the tool at the local hardware store, less than $5, and then it was a sinch. The splitter is a workhorse and does a great job on 24” logs, make kinlins easily. Just great all around.
customer_reviews.author: The Hippo

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Product was okay but missing screws shows lack on details on company part
customer_reviews.author: George t sindeband

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This splitter works like a dream! We love to go camping and have fires, so we were looking for something that we could use to split out own wood with and this truly works. My 9 year old daughter even enjoys splitting wood now! Can't wait for the many campfires to come!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron French

customer_reviews.title: Instruction manual assembly instructions are terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Instruction manual is too small and pictures are terrible! Detailed instructions are LACKING. Even illustrated parts breakdown is not detailed enough to try to figure out what goes where. Parts were missing and I had to look around my garage for a nut and screw to install the support.
customer_reviews.author: Ev

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This log splitter does a very good job, and is easy to move around and operate. That’s if you figure out first how to assemble it. Instructions provided are terrible, and I was never able to reach customer support for assistance.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Greco

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts!!!
customer_reviews.text: The wheels, wheel frame and required pieces to attach the wheels were all defective or missing.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Powerful for the money
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job without having to pay a couple thousand for a log splitter. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Andy Stene

customer_reviews.title: not as i expected
customer_reviews.text: very disappointed i had a 6 ton electric splitter and that one could not split some logs i figure i would buy a 9 ton one(50% more) i found out that the 9 does the same job if the 9 wasted money
customer_reviews.author: ciro di iorio

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. A very strong log splitter. Easy to assemble and easy to use. Highly recomended.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: I ordered a log splitter and received a safe!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a log splitter and received a safe. I want the item I paid for!
customer_reviews.author: Rich Runkle

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for half the cost of a gas powered log splitter.
customer_reviews.text: Great machine for my needs. It split fresh oak logs 12 inch diameter with ease. It is fast enough to keep me busy with the split logs. It built very well and should last for years.
customer_reviews.author: JERRY PARKER

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: one of the best tools I ever bought very happy with it

customer_reviews.title: ... husband just split 20 inch freshly cut red oak pretty easily. small compact and powerful
customer_reviews.text: my husband just split 20 inch freshly cut red oak pretty easily. small compact and powerful. he really likes it
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: I just received to log splitter from my daughter I use it on a stump I had works great does the job. My son-in-law broke my old one I had never replace it so surprise when I seen it at my door! Awesome Carmine.
customer_reviews.author: Charity

customer_reviews.title: Love you.
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful log splitter. Can split log after log with no problems. Love you.

customer_reviews.title: Suprise on the upside with this Puppy
customer_reviews.text: Much better than I expected, cuts through hardwoods like hot knife through butter.

Powerhouse Log Splitters are the essence of what a 21st century log splitter should be. Rendered in only the most contemporary design, rugged, and functional to the point of effortlessness, Powerhouse Log Splitters have left a remarkable impression on customers all over the world.

The Powerhouse 9-Ton Log Splitter delivers consistently powerful and dependable log-splitting performance. No fumes, low-noise operation. Delivering increased torque by as much as 45% with its patented hydraulic ram design, the Powerhouse 9-Ton Log Splitter is as versatile as it is powerful. Its electric motor means fumeless and much quieter operation than gas-powered splitters.
